lines.gurmukhi: pUrn bHm gur mihmw khY su QorI kQnI bdnI bwid nyq nyq nyq hY
lines.transliteration_english: Pooran Braham Gur Mahimaa Kahai Su Doree , Kadanee Badanee Baadi Nayt Nayt Nayt Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: How much one may praise the True Guru, the embodiment of the complete God on the Earth, is still not enough. It is futile to say in words because He is infinite, limitless and fathomless.

lines.gurmukhi: pUrn bHm gur pUrn srbmeI inMdw krIAY su kw kI nmo nmo hyq hY
lines.transliteration_english: Pooran Braham Gur Pooran Sarabamaee , Nindaa Kareeai Su Kaa Kee Namo Namo Hayt Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: True Guru the embodiment of all-pervading Lord is completely manifested in all living beings. Then who should be cursed and slandered? He is worthy of salutation again and again.

lines.gurmukhi: qwhI qy ibvrjq Asuqiq inMdw doaU AkQ kQw bIcwir moin bRq lyq hY
lines.transliteration_english: Taahee Tay Bivarajat Asoutati Nindaa Dooo , Akad Kadaa Beechaari Moni Brat Layt Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: And it is for this reason that a Guru-conscious person is forbidden to praise or slander anyone. He remains engrossed in the contemplation of the indescribable True Guru of unique form.

lines.gurmukhi: bwl buiD suiD kir dyh kY ibdyh Bey jIvn mukiq giq ibsm sucyq hY ]262]
lines.transliteration_english: Baal Budhi Sudhi Kari Dayh Kai Bidayh Bhaay , Jeevan Moukati Gati Bisam Souchayt Hai ?262?

Shabad OS B.translation: A disciple of the Guru advances towards the state of living dead by leading a life of childlike innocence and discarding all external adorations. But he is ever alert and conscious of mind in a strange way. (262)
